title: Understanding Ideal Gas Laws
text: Since hydrogen behaves as an ideal gas under given conditions, use the ideal gas law $$(PV=nRT)$$. Try to find a relationship between the initial and final temperatures using this law.

title: Using the Ideal Gas Law
text: Write down the ideal gas law equation: $$\frac{P_1 V_1}{n_1}$$ $$R_1$$ $$=$$ $$T_1$$ and $$\frac{P_2 V_2}{n_2}$$ $$R_2$$ $$=$$ $$T_2$$. Identify what's constant and what's changing.

title: Canceling Constants
text: Since the process is at constant pressure and R (the ideal gas constant) is also constant, these will cancel out in your equation transformations.

title: Substitute Known Values
text: Substitute the known values into the equation $$\frac{V_2 T_1}{V_1}=$$ $$T_2$$. Remember the initial volume $$V_1=100$$ L, the final volume $$V_2=50$$ L, and the initial pressure $$P_1=2$$ atm.

title: Find the Initial Temperature
text: To complete the calculation, you'll first need to compute the initial temperature $$T_1$$ using $$T_1=\frac{P_1 V_1}{nR}$$. Use $$R=0.0821$$ $$\frac{atmL}{mol}$$ K.

title: Compute Final Temperature
text: Using calculated T1, substitute back into $$T_2=\frac{50T_1}{100}$$ to find the final temperature T2.
